intro: Ochthocosmus parvifolius, commonly known as the small-leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers with white ray florets. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Ochthocosmus parvifolius is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
